# The `Region` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The main job of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/region">Region</a> is to point to new instructions generated by vectorization passes. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::sandboxir::Region</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

The main job of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/region">Region</a> is to point to new instructions generated by vectorization passes.

It is the unit that RegionPasses operate on with their runOnRegion() function.

The region allows us to stack transformations horizontally, meaning that each transformation operates on a single region and the resulting region is the input to the next transformation, as opposed to vertically, which is the common way of applying a transformation across the whole function. This enables us to check for profitability and decide whether we accept or rollback at a region granularity, which is much better than doing this at the function level.

Definition at line 91 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/region-h">Region.h</a>.

  prototype={<>SetVector&lt;Instruction &#42;&gt; llvm::sandboxir::Region::Insts</>}>
All the instructions in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/region">Region</a>.

Only new instructions generated during vectorization are part of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/region">Region</a>.
